Desc.entry: Tai Chi cultivates balance, concentration, sensitivity, flexibility and inner strength. Practices chi kung, the wu tai chi form, meditation and push-hands. Chi kung consists of exercises combining breathing with different movements and stretches to promote circulation and calmness. The form is a sequence of movements which flow one into the next which gives clear awareness of the body, alignment, balance, tension and how to release tension. Push-hands is a flowing two-person exercise which teaches sensitivity, concentration and timing.

category.entry: MARTIAL ARTS - TAI CHI, QI GONG AND CAPOEIRA
